title: @Meddler Curiosity about the Veigar buffs
body:
Sooooo after hearing a little diddy about why the changes to the master of evil took place in the first place, I want to know why you chose the buffs that you did? I am just wanting to understand your standpoint, considering the backlash over the bad. I am not wanting them reversed, or an apology over any real/perceived injustices, just curious about some of the reasoning for the choices? I was wondering about why Q increase speed to the skillshot over, something like increasing the radius of W? I like to know if there was a tiny bit more you could elaborate on, but was not able to during all the backlash. I thank you for the current changes on the PBE for our awesome master and anything to accomplish his short term and long term goals of world domination. I want a good healthy discussion on Veigar, but have only found comments about the changes themselves. Lets talk and see about what this may mean for his future in the game, something that I did not really see communicated though the process that I think should be interesting to see.

TL:DR @Meddler since you have commented on some of the choices for the negatives, lets hear your side for the design of the good.

Edit: For more on what meddler stated about the changes look here:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Q6AojjfV-not-a-riot-bashing-post-why-was-veigar-changed-at-this-point-in-this-way?comment=002d00040000

And thanks for commenting Meddler! My first red post ever! XD

Current PBE changes here, including a video:

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/03/33-pbe-update.html

replies.body:
Our conclusion after looking at Veigar in 5.4 was that we'd reduced his reliability more than intended. We're looking to correct that, give him some control back, hence the increased Q missile speed, reduced time till stun on E, and the E stopping dashes/jumps in progress (that one also plays up the 'trapped in a cage' gameplay and thematics as well).  

Once those changes are out we'll then assess again, see if he needs further work still.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=brOcdPAP,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-04T05:50:26.904+0000)
>
> Our conclusion after looking at Veigar in 5.4 was that we'd reduced his reliability more than intended. We're looking to correct that, give him some control back, hence the increased Q missile speed, reduced time till stun on E, and the E stopping dashes/jumps in progress (that one also plays up the 'trapped in a cage' gameplay and thematics as well).  
> 
> Once those changes are out we'll then assess again, see if he needs further work still.

It really, really bothers me that **[there's no more reason for anyone to actually be stunned by his E any longer.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/kMxmMEAE-veigar-tries-to-get-riot-to-make-him-a-new-event-horizon)** Given the delay, unless someone is already locked in place, the only way they're getting stunned is if they run into the walls for some reason. I didn't really like the edge-stun mechanic, but this new version is even stranger—it's a "stun" that only stuns the target if they decide to be stunned. Outside of some weird chase scenarios, there's no reason why someone would want to be stunned for 2s instead of being free to move around (and indeed free to kill Veigar, which is what happened to Veigars who missed their stuns pre-5.4, and happens to them all the time now) for 3s.

If the cage's duration were increased, or if **[some other mechanic](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/OEuzazm2-veigars-event-horizon-needs-a-new-mechanic-lets-come-up-with-ideas)** (e.g. MR shred inside) were added in such that the enemy might genuinely want to stun themself, it might be more interesting. Alternatively, if the cage gained a mechanic that allowed him to stun a target inside the cage by landing a Q, that would provide another means by which this "stun" might actually stun the target.

As it is, it's only stunning people because they're confused about how the skill works. I don't think that's a strong basis for an ability.

I love Cho's Rupture, but that's a completely different skill: that's a large filled circle, not a ring, and while someone can generally escape it before it goes off, that requires immediately bolting for the nearest edge. All you have to do to not be stunned by Veigar's "stun" is to move slightly in any direction. Also relevant: Cho'gath does not instantly die if he misses a Rupture.

As for "trapping them inside the cage", well, ask any Veigar main (you did talk to Veigar mains, didn't you? You did call up Nyjacky and Dabox before redoing Veigar, right?) what happened to pre-5.4 Veigar when he missed his stun. The answer: you die, and you look absolutely ridiculous.

I'm sure you can buff his numbers up to the point where he's viable, but his gameplay is so flat now. He just sort of throws damage at the enemy team. There's no more cat-and-mouse game with the enemy squishies, no more concern about positioning…you just trade punches with the enemy until one of you dies. (Hint: Veigar dies.) Old Veigar was much more dramatic: you were either in control and terrifying or out of control and absurd. New Veigar is just always "meh".

I hate edge-stunning. I also actually hated rushing DFG every match, and I hated even more the way I'd sometimes fail to get DFG to go off and end up bringing someone down to 5% health only to be exploded before I realized what happened. ("How did she survive that? Wait, why isn't DFG on cooldown?") Taking away the edge-stun on his cage (even though, let's be clear, that's the only reason someone ever should be stunned by that ability) is reasonable, so long as you insert some new mechanic to make it an interesting skill again. I think we're **[still waiting on that.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/kMxmMEAE-veigar-tries-to-get-riot-to-make-him-a-new-event-horizon)**

It seems like Veigar is meant to transition from burst mage to poke mage.

Poke enemies with your Q. Zone them with E then poke at them with W as they walk around to CS. Then, after you've poked them down with Q's and W's, you ult them. The problem is that Veigar lacks much of the safety of other poke mages.

It'll be odd to see how this plays out.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=brOcdPAP,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2015-03-04T06:43:59.852+0000)
>
> It seems like Veigar is meant to transition from burst mage to poke mage.
> 
> Poke enemies with your Q. Zone them with E then poke at them with W as they walk around to CS. Then, after you've poked them down with Q's and Was, you ult them. The problem is that Veigar lacks much of the safety of other poke mages.
> 
> It'll be odd to see how this plays out.

I think that's exactly it: he feels like a poke-mage now. And he's not a particularly interesting poke mage, either.

Old Veigar was interesting in part because there were two things he could do: 100-0 a valuable squishy, and use his stun and meteors to break the enemy's teamfighting power. You were often balancing between those two; in rare cases, you could go double-or-nothing and try to do both, at an increased risk of accomplishing neither.

That dynamic tension is gone. He can't really 100-0 a target, and if he does, it doesn't involve throwing his stun on an out-of-position squishy. If you fall down to Wood Tier, yes, you'll see some people freak out and run into the wall because they don't understand how it works, and yes, you can then do a full rotation on them (assuming Q doesn't get minion-blocked), but that's a side-effect of the recency of these changes. You certainly don't have to decide between catching two bruisers in the stun versus catching one mage in it; you no longer aim the stun, you just toss it in the middle of the fight and hope someone doesn't notice it.

I don't feel like I'm making any interesting decisions when playing him now. I'm just chucking damage at the enemy. It's supremely dull. To be honest, it feels like I'm playing Old Veigar in a very lazy way. When I got lazy with Old Veigar, I'd AFK farm in lane and just sort of toss my stun in the middle of the fight without worrying about hitting anyone. If there's a difference between playing New Veigar seriously and playing him halfheartedly, I don't know what it is.
speaking of "odd" look at fizz, top bruiser

> the E stopping dashes/jumps in progress (that one also plays up the 'trapped in a cage' gameplay and thematics as well).  

This is an absolutely fantastic mechanic.  Please use more.
 
> Once those changes are out we'll then assess again, see if he needs further work still.

I very much expect further work is in your future.

In particular, I think W was designed more or less only for use with E, at least when it comes to hitting champions.  Now that E is less reliable, why not buff it to be an ability you can use without landing the stun?

That's not a guaranteed change, but places like Veigar's E and Ryze's W are where we think it's got the potential to be an appropriate mechanic. 

> I very much expect further work is in your future.
> 
> In particular, I think W was designed more or less only for use with E, at least when it comes to hitting champions.  Now that E is less reliable, why not buff it to be an ability you can use without landing the stun?

Adding ad ratios to it would make him unstoppable, he is supposed to be countered by champs who build damage, not ap.

Is he really? not only that,is that even an identity worth pursuing?
might be worth mentioning that dota's antimage really isn't much of an antimage.
I mean take kass(let's ignore the nerfs for a moment,and his current power level) another anti mage,his q just gives him a magic shield,negating poke from ap champions for no reason,laning against him(when he's strong) as a mage is crazy obnoxious,you just can't touch the faggot,in contrast go against him with an ad laner and his shield(and passive) just does absolutely nothing,so either he get's a lame matchup,where one of his skill does half of what it can do,or you get a crazy lame matchup,where he get's a shield for no reason.

numerical counters are just flat out an incredibly lame idea.

Just look at how it will work,if enemy mid is picked(and is ap) he is now in for an obnoxious matchup,if kass is picked first(and enemy is trying to win) he will face an ad champion,now the matchup is obnoxious for him,so as you can see the standard anti mage game is going to be obnoxious to someone(and effortless for the other),it's just a very poor identity,not worth having.

>And removing that from him turns him into a crappy poke mage.

so what you are saying is that if he goes against an ad mid,he turns into a crappy poke mage,once again,is that really an identity worth pursuing?

> Adding ad ratios to it would make him unstoppable, he is supposed to be countered by champs who build damage, not ap.

Why? for the most part it will just put his ad matchups in the same spot his ap matchups are,plus some extra effectiveness against adcs(which he has issues getting to anyway).

As it currently stands one of his numbers just doesn't apply to certain matchups,that's both a lame weakness and a lame strength,making him an anti carry makes much more sense,removing it and increasing the base ratio also makes more sense.

What's the difference between dash/jump and flash/blink? For clarity sake. You need a glossary for these terms.

Dash: character is seen visibly moving to the end location.

Blink: character "warps" to the final position, skipping the points in between.

examples - Dash - kalista's hops, wukong's nimbus strike, xin's e.
blink - ezreal, zed's shadow jumping, flash summoner spell.

Meddler, you do realize that for people playing Veigar, whether or not his stun lands depends on how un-skilled his opponents are right?( Whether or not they're dumb enough to run into the wall)  There's literally no way to prevent assassins from getting to veigar as long as the delay exists. The q change was ok, but the delay on his e was totally uncalled for given how you aren't adding any "windows of oppurtunity" for veigar to outplay extremely mobile champions {{champion:7}} {{champion:238}}

Is there a chance we will see a completly changed w or at least some sort of buff to it's utility? Right now it feels like a spell that was left over and forgotten. To be honest I very much doubt if you would design Veigar nowadays that you would include a spell that is only hitable when you succeed in stunning with your difficult to place e. While this is kinda interesting, it's just not very rewarding if the only thing it does is damage, you already got a reliable q-hit and r as reward for hitting your stun. Veigar is anyway neither longranged enough nor mobile enough to have other save options to unload his kit.

I'm sorry, but I find this hard to believe. Who exactly told you that this wouldn't be a massive nerf?

I mentioned the "changes" to some friends, and to a one they responded that they thought I was kidding, and that this would completely wreck Veigar. It made every stun into a missed stun. They generally agreed that the Q changes were unpredictable, but doubted that they could possibly compensate him for the loss of his stun. And it was the loss of his stun—there is simply no reason for anyone to be stunned by Veigar's E any longer, unless they deliberately run into it.

It's not so much the nerf that I'm concerned about, though. I've played almost exclusively Veigar; I do not mind playing underpowered, even non-viable Champions. What I'm concerned about is that his strategic depth seems to have vanished. He's now some kind of poke mage who AFK farms during lanephase. Yes, he can burst people, but there's no dramatic moment where you risk everything to land a stun and chain a full rotation onto an out-of-position enemy: instead, sometimes you notice someone's low, and so you push R and they die.

Adding some kind of distinctive new mechanic onto his E could fix this, but so far, the changes seem to be premised on the idea that anyone should ever be stunned by his new E.

I think a question we should be asking ourselves is this: "is it possible to have too *much* counterplay?" and if so, "are we adding too much?"

I'm willing to wager yes to both. There is merit in counter play, don't get me wrong, but I feel that as of late, riot is putting too much focus on it at the expense of cohesion and the player's ability to think outside the box.

If a player's response to any champ the enemy picks is, "just dodge what he throws out and I'll be good, then you've got a problem. There need to be more factors than just "get better at dodging stuff"

I firmly believe that a healthy does of instant cc is necessary for game health, provided there are counter measures players can take to negate or abate it. At present, league has several tools to do just that: tenacity, to reduce the duration; banshee's, to negate it entirely; and qss, mikaels, and cleanse, to remove it if applied.

"But Thryale! how can something so inherently toxic as instant cc be *healthy* for league?"

Simple really: it causes the players to approach the game differently. Variety is the spice of life, and monotony is killing league. I've played tons of games of league where it each game hardly felt any different than the last. Dodge this skill shot, land that skill shot, etc. The thing about instant cc is you can't be careless. You can't just walk around and think you'll be fine as long as you can rely on your reflexes to get you outta dodge, you need to constantly keep your opponent's position in mind and their ranges. You are now calculating what it will take to get to them or how to scare them away so that they can't use that cc when they need it.

Now, that is not to say instant hard cc should become common place. Far from it. But when applied sparingly (in this case, all that comes to mind is veigar, amu, liss, fid, ram, annie, and ryze) it can be beneficial to the game to prevent players from falling into a repetitive mindset.
